entries.author: tatsuhiko_miyagawa
entries.title: friendfeed.com/cpan is shut down
entries.text: We can say "buh-bye", as the CPAN bot on FriendFeed has now officially booted its last bit.

entries.title: Looking for HTML::FormFu patches and contributions
entries.text: Dean took over the maintainership of HTML::FormFu. You or your team wish to see some new features or bug fixes worked on? Poke him.

entries.author: ricardo_signes
entries.title: Q&A with Larry Wall
entries.text: There will be a Q&A session with Larry Wall at YAPC::NA 2015. Have a burning question you'd like to see him answer? Ricardo tells you how to submit it.

entries.title: NYC Perl Hackathon 2015 has its own Mini CPAN PR Challenge
entries.author: charlie_gonzalez
entries.text: There will be a hackaton in New York city in May. Want to go but don't know on what to work? Don't worry: they'll have a mini-CPAN PR challenge just for that.
What landed on CPAN in March and seems interesting? David tells us.
entries.title: What's New on CPAN - March 2015

entries.text: Perl 5.22 is coming. What to know what the future has in reserves? brian offers us a sneak peek.
entries.title: A preview of Perl 5.22
entries.author: brian_d_foy
mark_keating
entries.title: One Decade Down 01
entries.text: Shadowcat Systems is 10 year old! If there was ever an occasion to raise a pint, this is it. Many happy returns, guys!

entries.title: How Perl + StickK helped me get organized
entries.text: David Mertens uses a punishment-and-reward system to get things done. Using the StickK website, he sets himself some goals. He manages to acheive them? A little more code enriches the Perl world. He fails? The site donates to the Perl Foundation using his credit card. Both ways, we win. I like that.
New release of the module that gives you more Moose for less boiler-plate. Now with 73% more constraints! And it's a good thing, I swear!
entries.author: chris_weyl
entries.title: MX::AttributeShortcuts --  now with Moo-style type constraints

entries.text: Unsightly? Never. But unsignly? From this week on.
entries.title: Happy easter, enjoy your unsigned types!
Using Amazon SES and SNS from Perl.
entries.author: jt_smith
entries.text: Pretty much what it says on the tin.

entries.title: CPAN great modules released last week

header: Imitation, flattery, you know how the saying goes. Seems that our Neil tapped into something good, for the upcoming New York City Hackaton is going to have its own mini-CPAN PR Challenge -- which I find brilliant. In other news, Perl 5.22 is around the corner (yay!), and so is conference season. Hmmm... Which means I should probably begin to see what my Summer schedule should look like. And so should you, dear reader, so should you. ~ `/anick
subject: The CPAN PR Challenge Now Has a Mini-Me!
